fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description:
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a statistical measure of change, over time, of the prices of goods and services in major expenditure groups--such as food, housing, apparel, transportation, and medical care--typically purchased by urban consumers. Essentially, it compares the cost of a sample "market basket" of goods and services in a specific month relative to the cost of the same "market basket" in an earlier reference period. This reference period is designated as the base period.


The CPI publishes indexes for two populations; all urban consumers (CU) and urban wage earners and clerical workers (CW). This dataset is for all urban consumers.


To construct the two indexes, thousands of prices for commodities and services purchased by consumers are collected in a sample of 75 urban places. Rent data is collected in a separate sample of thousands of rental units. Comparison of indexes for individual CMSA's or cities show only the relative change over time in prices between locations. These indexes cannot be used to measure interarea differences in price levels or living costs.
fields.dataset_citation: US Bureau of Labor Statistics, 2018, "Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U)", https://download.bls.gov/pub/time.series/cu/, US Bureau of Labor Statistics [Distributor], 1 [Version]

beat.description: Indicates the beat where the incident occurred. A beat is the smallest police geographic area  each beat has a dedicated police beat car. Three to five beats make up a police sector, and three sectors make up a police district. The Chicago Police Department has 22 police districts. See the beats at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/aerh-rz74.

date.description: Date when the incident occurred. this is sometimes a best estimate.

iucr.description: The Illinois Unifrom Crime Reporting code. This is directly linked to the Primary Type and Description. See the list of IUCR codes at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/c7ck-438e. A lookup for these codes is also available in the documentation folder of this dataset.

ward.description: The ward (City Council district) where the incident occurred. See the wards at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/sp34-6z76.

block.description: The partially redacted address where the incident occurred, placing it on the same block as the actual address.

arrest.description: Indicates whether an arrest was made.

district.description: Indicates the police district where the incident occurred. See the districts at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/fthy-xz3r.

domestic.description: Indicates whether the incident was domestic-related as defined by the Illinois Domestic Violence Act.

fbi_code.description: Indicates the crime classification as outlined in the FBI's National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS). See the Chicago Police Department listing of these classifications at http://gis.chicagopolice.org/clearmap_crime_sums/crime_types.html.

latitude.description: The latitude of the location where the incident occurred. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

location.description: The location where the incident occurred in a format that allows for creation of maps and other geographic operations on this data portal. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location where the incident occurred. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

updated_on.description: Date and time the record was last updated.

case_number.description: The Chicago Police Department RD Number (Records Division Number), which is unique to the incident.

description.description: The secondary description of the IUCR code, a subcategory of the primary description.

primary_type.description: The primary description of the IUCR code.

x_coordinate.description: The x coordinate of the location where the incident occurred in State Plane Illinois East NAD 1983 projection. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

y_coordinate.description: The y coordinate of the location where the incident occurred in State Plane Illinois East NAD 1983 projection. This location is shifted from the actual location for partial redaction but falls on the same block.

community_area.description: Indicates the community area where the incident occurred. Chicago has 77 community areas. See the community areas at https://data.cityofchicago.org/d/cauq-8yn6.

location_description.description: Description of the location where the incident occurred.

fields.access_requirements: No access restrictions on this dataset
fields.description: This dataset reflects reported incidents of crime (with the exception of murders where data exists for each victim) that occurred in the City of Chicago from 2001 to present, minus the most recent seven days. Data is extracted from the Chicago Police Department's CLEAR (Citizen Law Enforcement Analysis and Reporting) system. In order to protect the privacy of crime victims, addresses are shown at the block level only and specific locations are not identified. Should you have questions about this dataset, you may contact the Research & Development Division of the Chicago Police Department at PSITAdministration@ChicagoPolice.org. Disclaimer: These crimes may be based upon preliminary information supplied to the Police Department by the reporting parties that have not been verified. The preliminary crime classifications may be changed at a later date based upon additional investigation and there is always the possibility of mechanical or human error. Therefore, the Chicago Police Department does not guarantee (either expressed or implied) the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or correct sequencing of the information and the information should not be used for comparison purposes over time. The Chicago Police Department will not be responsible for any error or omission, or for the use of, or the results obtained from the use of this information. All data visualizations on maps should be considered approximate and attempts to derive specific addresses are strictly prohibited. The Chicago Police Department is not responsible for the content of any off-site pages that are referenced by or that reference this web page other than an official City of Chicago or Chicago Police Department web page. The user specifically acknowledges that the Chicago Police Department is not responsible for any defamatory, offensive, misleading, or illegal conduct of other users, links, or third parties and that the risk of injury from the foregoing rests entirely with the user. The unauthorized use of the words "Chicago Police Department," "Chicago Police," or any colorable imitation of these words or the unauthorized use of the Chicago Police Department logo is unlawful. This web page does not, in any way, authorize such use. Data are updated daily. The dataset contains more than 65,000 records/rows of data and cannot be viewed in full in Microsoft Excel. Therefore, when downloading the file, select CSV from the Export menu. Open the file in an ASCII text editor, such as Wordpad, to view and search. To access a list of Chicago Police Department - Illinois Uniform Crime Reporting (IUCR) codes, go to http://data.cityofchicago.org/Public-Safety/Chicago-Police-Department-Illinois-Uniform-Crime-R/c7ck-438e.  A lookup for these codes is also available in the documentation folder of this dataset.

The user shall not attempt to re-identify individuals represented in the data and agree not to disclose any data contained here to any unauthorized parties. Any analyses and data products derived from the data must be reviewed by the USDA before export from this system.

ean.description: 12 digit International Article Number (UPC code). May match up with other data sets.

upc.description: 14 digit UPC code. First two digits are special to IRI. To match to other datasets, probably use EAN. Format is: 2 digits system/5 digits manufacturer/5 digits item/2 digits generation. Note: For perishable data the system number will be 20-26 and the generation equal to 00. Target stores private label products all have system=66

aisle.description: Aisle - second most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy (perishables dictionary doesnt have this)

brand.description: Specific brand name of product. For more general brand name, see variable major_brand in product_dictionary_master.

upc_2.description: Do not use. Does not match across tables.

deptid.description: Department - most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy

parent.description: Parent company that manufacturers the product. See Dictionary_Details for an example.

num_nfp.description: Number of nutrients from nutrition fact panel on the back of the package.

product.description: Product - fourth most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy

upcdesc.description: Description of the UPC (in words, no abbreviations). UPCdesc format may differ across years.

category.description: Category - third most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy. Categories may differ across years.

flag_dup.description: There are multiple records for some EANs (1-keep,2-duplicate).

num_type.description: Number of type variables in product_dictionary_master used to create the variable Claims in this dictionary.

num_other.description: Number of other descriptor variables in product_dictionary_master used to create the variable Claims in this dictionary.

num_range.description: Number of nutrients from the ones we have 'ranges' for

num_style.description: Number of style descriptor variables in product_dictionary_master used to create the variable Claims in this dictionary.

tot_units.description: Unit of measure (COUNT, LITER, OZ, LBS)

num_claims.description: Number of claims variables in product_dictionary_master used to create the variable Claims in this dictionary.

num_flavor.description: Number of flavors variables in product_dictionary_master used to create the variable Claims in this dictionary.

week_moved.description: IRI week the UPC last appeared in the retail data.

other_codes.description: Other descriptors: codes to unpack values

manufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the product. See Dictionary_Details for an example.

num_nutr_claims.description: Number of nutrition related claims variables in product_dictionary_master used to create the variable Claims in this dictionary.

upc.description: UPC to identify unique products. For random weight products, this is a fake UPC used to track products over time.

mop.description: Method of payment, See TripCode for details.

panid.description: Panel id: use to link to other IRI household data sets

purdate.description: Date of trip for time series use (YYYYMMDD)

quantity.description: Total units purchased. May not be an accurate representation of total items purchased if any RW items were purchased as part of trip basket.

channelid.description: Outlet Code- see Trip Code for outlet/channel codes.

storename.description: Code for retail chain/store name. See TripCode for details.

tripnumber.description: Trip Sequence (if multiple trips in one day)

femp.description: Number of hours per week female head is employmed

memp.description: Number of hours per week Male head is employmed

year.description: Year. Demographics do not channge from 2008-12 (other than projection factors). See documentation for more details.

panid.description: Household panel ID. Unique household identifier to match to other IRI data sets. This is the same as Nielsen HHID, with the addition of a leading "9."

blockid.description: Census block. In previous years, "censusid" or "censusblock10." Use 2012 for 2008-12.

rentown.description: Whether household rents or owns home

wic_jan.description: WIC participation, surveyed in Jan *Only June available 2017 forward

snap_jan.description: SNAP participation, surveyed in Jan *Only June available 2017 forward

wic_june.description: WIC participation, surveyed in June, see DemoCode for codes

snap_june.description: SNAP participation, surveyed in June, see DemoCode for codes

state_county.description: FIPS code. State and county FIPS code of residence

block2000_flag.description: "1" indicates that lat/long came from 2000 block instead of 2010 block. Use 2012 for 2008-12.

block_longitude.description: Census block centroid longitude (can be either 2010 or 2000 Census block). Use 2012 for 2008-12.

upc.description: UPC to identify unique products. For fixed weight products, this is the real UPC from the manufacturer. For random weight products, this is a fake UPC assigned by FreshLook to track products over time. We have a PLU-UPC mapping for produce (see Excel workbook "Perishables_Units_ConvertFactor_UPCPLUMap.xlsx").

type.description: Preparation, bone (meat), storage, color, subvariety, origin (produce)

style.description: Kosher, package size, package type (fixed or random weight produce), processing

deptid.description: Department - most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy

product.description: Product - third most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy ("Segment" in original product dictionary)

variety.description: Variety - fourth most aggregate (and most disaggregate) category in IRI's product category hierarchy for perishables (this variable is not on POS product dictionary)

category.description: Category - second most aggregate category in IRI's product category hierarchy for perishables

meat_bone.description: Bone or boneless. This information was in the "type" variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

meat_form.description: Meat Form. This information was in the "other"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

tot_units.description: "OZ" for all packaged produce, blank  for RW

meat_claim.description: Claims for meat, including Kosher, organic, natural, and others. This information was in the "claim" variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

tot_volume.description: Number of ounces for fixed weight produce

meat_storage.description: Storage, including fresh or frozen. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_form.description: Produce Form. This information was in the "other"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_size.description: Size, including small and large. This information was in the "style"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

seafood_form.description: Seafood Form, including filet, whole, steak, nugget, etc. This information was in the "other"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_color.description: Color. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_origin.description: Origin. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_organic.description: Organic or conventional. This information was in the "claims" variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_process.description: Process. This information was in the "style"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_storage.description: Storage, including packaged, bagged, clamshell, etc. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

seafood_storage.description: Storage, including fresh or frozen. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

deli_meat_kosher.description: Regular or Kosher. This information was in the "style"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

meat_preparation.description: Preparation, including cooked, smoked, marinated, etc. This information was in the "other"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_packtype.description: FW for fixed weight, RW for random weight. This information was in the "style"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

deli_meat_healthy.description: Claims such as regular, low fat, low sodium, natural, etc. This information was in the "claims" variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

meat_package_size.description: Regular or Family. This information was in the "type" variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_subvariety.description: Subvariety. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

deli_cheese_healthy.description: Claims such as regular, low fat, low sodium, organic, RBST-free, etc. This information was in the "claims" variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_preparation.description: Preparation, including sliced, cut, no prep, etc. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

seafood_preparation.description: Preparation, including smoked, cooked, breaded, marinated, etc. This information was in the "type"  variable for previous years' data (2008-14).

produce_package_size.description: Package size  for fixed weight produce. This variable has been disaggregated into "tot_units" and "tot_volume"

mop.description: Method of payment. See TripCode tab for details.

deal.description: Whether product was on promotion or not. See TripCode tab for details

panid.description: Panel id: use to link to other IRI household data sets

price.description: Source of value in "dollarspaid" variable. See TripCode tab for details and IRI Methodology Report for how IRI assigns prices.

coupon.description: Coupon Dollars. Should subtract this value from dollarspaid to calculate final expenditure.

purdate.description: Date of trip for time series use (YYYYMMDD)

quantity.description: Units - need to use tot_oz, etc vbls in product dictionary to get total ounces etc for unit prices. NOTE: This variable does not accurately capture the number of units purchased for RW items. Only expenditures are available for RW purchases. Panelists are asked to always report quantity=1 for RW purchases.

channelid.description: Code for outlet/retailer type (called "channel" by IRI) - see TripCode tab for details

storename.description: Name of the retail chain. See TripCode tab for details.

tripnumber.description: Trip Sequence (if multiple trips in one day)

dollarspaid.description: Total expenditure before coupons. See IRI Methodology Report for how IRI assigns prices.

panid.description: Panel id: use to link to other IRI household data sets

iriweek.description: Symphony IRI week code- Reference IRI Weeks Conversion Table

rx_channelid.description: Channel type of location prescription was purchased

rx_insurance.description: Insurance prescription drug is covered under

location_reason.description: Reason respondent chose to purchase prescription at this location

rx_instructions.description: =1 if take as need, null otherwise

mail_order_reason.description: Reason respondent chose to use mail order

medical_condition.description: Medical condition drug is intended to treat

fields.description: Consumer food purchase data reported by households participating in the National Consumer Panel household survey. Households use in-home scanning devices to record their food-at-home purchases. Includes accompanying data sets of product information, household demographics, and (for a subsample of households) household health information and prescription drug purchases.
fields.dataset_citation: Information Resources, Inc. (IRI), 2018, "Consumer Network household-based scanner data", Administrative Data Research Facility [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.access_actions_required: This is restricted ADRF data. In order to access, you must have signed the appropriate non-disclosure agreement and agreed to the ADRF terms of usage.
fields.title: Information Resources, Inc. (IRI) InfoScan retail-based scanner data
fields.data_usage_policy: All data provided here are proprietary and subject to approved research project use. The user shall not attempt to re-identify individuals represented in the data and agree not to disclose any data contained here to any unauthorized parties. Any analyses and data products derived from the data must be reviewed by the USDA before export from this system.

UPC.description: 14 digit fake UPC code which identifies unique product keys (ie unique brand-categories). Matches on "UPC" to pd_pl_all.

Unit.description: Quantity, ie number of units sold. IRI does not provide total volume/weight of each product, so unit price cannot be calculated.

year.description: Year. For 2008-11, use "2012." Use IRIweek to distinguish years within 2008-12.

GeogKey.description: Uniquely identifies RMAs for each retailer. Matches to variable "GeogKey" in RMA_Info table.

IRIweek.description: 4 digit code for the week of the data delivery. Matches "IRIweek" in table IRIWeek.

Prodkey.description: Numeric code that represents the brand-categories (lowest level available) for private label products. Do not use - use UPC to match to dictionary.

Product_Key.description: Numeric code that represents the brand-categories (lowest level available) for private label products. Do not use - use UPC to match to dictionary.

UPC.description: 14 digit IRI UPC code. Matches to "UPC" in product_dictionary_perishables. Note: For perishable products, the first two digits will be 20-26 and the last two digits equal to 00.

Unit.description: Quantity, ie number of units sold. Generally in pounds, sometimes counts. See workbook "Perishables_unit_convertfactor_upcplumap.xslx" for details.

IRIWeek.description: 4 digit code for the week of the data delivery. Matches "IRIweek" in table IRIWeek.

StoreID.description: Uniquely identifies each store. Matches to variable "storeID" in Store_Info table.

UPC_Old.description: Original UPC from the retailer. Fresh Look recodes some UPCs to match their coding scheme and some of these may be duplicated across products

UPC.description: 14 digit IRI UPC code. Matches to "UPC" in product dictionary tables. Format is: 2 digits system code/5 digits manufacturer code/5 digits item code/2 digits generation code. Note: For perishable data the system number will be 20-26 and the generation equal to 00. Brand/category level private label products all have system=66.

Unit.description: Quantity, ie number of units sold. Must be combined with tot_volume in product_dictionary_pos to calculate total volume sold or unit price.

IRIWeek.description: 4 digit code for the week of the data delivery. Matches "IRIweek" in table IRIWeek.

StoreID.description: Uniquely identifies each store. Matches to variable "storeID" in Store_Info table.

City.description: City of individual, brick and mortar store.

State.description: State of individual, brick and mortar store.

Address.description: Address of individual, brick and mortar store.

GeogKey.description: Uniquely identifies RMAs for each retailer. Links to sales data pos_rma, rw_rma, privatelabel_rma.

StoreID.description: Store number assigned by IRI. Populated for most RMA stores, but not all. Does not link to transaction tables.

Zipcode.description: Zip code of individual, brick and mortar store.

RMA_Name.description: Name of RMA, includes retailer name and geographic area

CountyName.description: Name of the county of individual, brick and mortar store.

Store_Name.description: This is the specific name of the individual, brick and mortar store. IRI refers to this as the "banner name".

TractFIPS10.description: FIPS code of state, county and tract based on 2010 Census. Identified by ERS.

CountyFIPS10.description: FIPS code of state and county. Identified by ERS.

ERS_RMAStoreID.description: A code to uniquely identify each store in the RMA_info list. This equals StoreID where IRI delivered one; otherwise it is a made up by ERS. N/A after 2012 since all geogkeys were unique after 2012.

Parent_Company.description: Parent company. Above "store_name" on company hierarchy.

RMA_StoreCount.description: Number of individual, brick and mortar stores within the RMA. Can be used to calculate average DOLLARS or UNIT when joined with sales data pos_rma, rw_rma, and privatelabel_rma.

BlockGroupFIPS10.description: FIPS code of state, county, tract and block group based on 2010 Census. Identified by ERS.

Retailer_Store_Number.description: Store number assigned by the retailer.

fields.description: Wage sums and number of employers' for each person by quarter.  This set is created to examine workforce outcomes for students K-12, higher education, unemployment claimants returning to work, and our DWD customers receiving services from our local offices.  This data set includes:  social security number, year/quarter that the wage was earned, wage sum, and number of employers.  Data is gathered from employers UC-5 quarterly tax filings.

cnty.description: County of employer in Indiana. Lookup file for this field is countyfips_regions_lookup.csv, matching from field cnty to field CountyFIPS

uiacct.description: Unemployment Insurance account number for employer (hashed)

fields.description: Wage records for each person by quarter by employer.  This set is created to examine workforce outcomes for students K-12, higher education, unemployment claimants returning to work, and our DWD customers receiving services from our local offices.  This data set includes:  social security number, year/quarter that the wage was earned, Unemployment Insurance (UI) account number, Federal Identification Employer Number (FEIN), wages earned from the employer, 3-digit industry NAICS code, county and Indiana economic growth region of employer.  Data is gathered from employers' UC-5 quarterly tax filings.

gender_code.description: Student's gender. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = GenderCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the GenderCode in this table to the Code field to get the label.

location_code.description: The Indiana county, U.S. state, or country of origin for the student at the time of first admission to an institution. Lookup file in higher_ed_codes.csv.  In this file, select Field = LocationCode to obtain the codes and the labels.  Then match the LocationCode in this table to the Code field to get the label. Location codes '001' through '092' represent Indiana county codes.  Codes '101' through '151' represent state codes.  Codes '201' through '965' represent country codes and code '940', '942', '999' represents 'unknown'

fields.description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) Data for the state of Indiana. Temporary Assistance for Needy Families is a program that provides cash assistance and supportive services to assist families with children under age 18, helping them achieve economic self-sufficiency. Children under 18 who are living with their parent(s) or relative such as a grandparent, aunt, uncle etc., who meet specific nonfinancial criteria and whose countable family monthly income meets the following income guidelines. Data includes information about children, adults, and families in the TANF program in the state of Indiana. This includes demographic data, information about custodian job search, community service hours, EITC information, and family relationships of recipients.

fields.title: FoodAPS National Household Food Acquisition and Purchase Survey
fields.data_usage_policy: All data provided here are proprietary and subject to approved research project use. The user shall not attempt to re-identify individuals represented in the data and agree not to disclose any data contained here to any unauthorized parties. Any analyses and data products derived from the data must be reviewed by the USDA before export from this system.
fields.description: USDA's National Household Food Acquisition and Purchase Survey (FoodAPS) is the first nationally representative survey of American households to collect unique and comprehensive data about household food purchases and acquisitions. Detailed information was collected about foods purchased or otherwise acquired for consumption at home and away from home, including foods acquired through food and nutrition assistance programs. The survey includes nationally representative data from 4,826 households, including Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) households, low-income households not participating in SNAP, and higher income households.

fields.description: This file includes publicly available Higher Education Research and Development Survey data downloaded from NSF in July 2019. HERD is the primary source of information on R&D expenditures at U.S. colleges and universities. The survey is an annual census of institutions that expended at least $150,000 in separately accounted for R&D in the fiscal year. In addition to R&D expenditures, this provides data on institutional characteristics (i.e., highest degree granted, historically black college or university [HBCU], high Hispanic enrollment [HHE], public or private control).

fields.access_requirements: Public / Open Access (no data use agreement required)
fields.description: This version of the Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages (QCEW) covers annual location quotients for counties by two-digit NAICS codes from 2001-2018. Raw QCEW data was downloaded from the Bureau of Labor Statistic's website (https://www.bls.gov/cew/downloadable-data-files.htm). In order to generate this structure several data manipulation operations were done on the raw QCEW data. Most notably, the QCEW is originally structured at the FIPS/NAICS/Ownership level, with Ownership referring to the governmental ownership status of the associated establishments(e.g. private, federal government, local government, etc). In order to reduce the dataset to the FIPS/NAICS level, the raw location quotients were combined using weighted averages based on establishment count. In addition, county/NAICS combinations that did not pass BLS disclosure standards are not included and state level statistics for each industry are not included.

cfda.description: A five-digit CFDA (Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance) number retrieved from the unique_award_number that universities submit. This number is assigned to awards to represent the source of funding. If the first two digits are between 10 and 98, awards are federally funded. If the first two digits range between 00 and 09, or 99, sources of awards are most likely non-federal

campus_id.description: IRIS-generated identifier assigned to each campus for de-identification purposes. Each ID is a combination of institution_id and a serial number helpful to identify the campus to which a given award is made and by which the award is being administered

award_type.description: IRIS-generated flag that indicates whether each row is (1) federal research (2) federal non-research (3) non-federal.

sub_org_unit.description: IRIS-generated identifier assigned to sub-organization units to which each funded project is assigned, such as a particular college within a given IRIS member university. (This is not at the level of individual departments.) Each ID is a combination of campus_id described above and a serial number assigned to each sub-organization unit within each campus. This ID helps to identify the college or unit to which a given award is made and by which the award is being administered at a lower-level

institution_id.description: IRIS-generated unique identifier assigned to each IRIS member university for de-identification purposes. Values are four or five digit numbers

fed_awd_num_std.description: Unique identifier specifying a federal award; this is the same as the unique_award_number but with the CFDA number and white spaces removed. Null if CFDA is missing or the CFDA number indicates a non-federal award, i.e., a CFDA starting with two digit numbers between 00 and 09, or 99

period_end_date.description: End of period in which a monthly expense transaction took place; each period end day is the last day of a month: e.g., 3/30/2008 or 12/31/2014

overhead_charged.description: Actual overhead dollars charged to the award in the specified period

period_start_date.description: Beginning of period in which a monthly expense transaction took place; each period start day is the first day of a month: e.g., 4/1/2009 or 10/1/2015

unique_award_number.description: University-generated unique identifier specifying an award and its funding source, made up of the 5-digit funding source code (e.g., CFDA number) and an award identifier. Award identifier may include the awarding agency's federal award ID (e.g., federal grant number, contract number, or loan number) or an internal award ID for non-federal awards. Values may include a space or dash in between them: e.g., 10.310 2010-12345-54321 (USDA example), 47.050 1234567 (NSF example), 93.865 2-R01-DK-012345-15-S1 (NIH example), 00.000 1234567 and 00.200 State Award 1 (Non-federal grant examples)

funding_source_name_raw.description: Raw name of funding source assigned to each project; if university is a recipient of a prime award, the direct sponsor is the name of funding source; if university is a subrecipient of an award, this is the name of the pass-through entity (exceptions are noted in documentation)

recipient_account_number.description: A university's internal account number to uniquely identify each project; typically an accounting code used to allocate funds received from an award

funding_source_name_clean.description: Cleaned name of funding source assigned to each project; if university is a recipient of a prime award, the funding source name is the direct sponsor; if university is a subrecipient of an award, this is the name of the pass-through entity (exceptions noted in documentation)

total_direct_expenditures.description: Total direct expenditures charged to the award in the specified period

cfda.description: A five-digit CFDA (Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance) number retrieved from the unique_award_number that universities submit. This number is assigned to awards to represent the source of funding. If the first two digits are between 10 and 98, awards are federally funded. If the first two digits range between 00 and 09, or 99, sources of awards are most likely non-federal

soc_code.description: Standard Occupational Classification codes that are required for federal agency reporting (http://www.bls.gov/soc/); each occupation in the SOC is placed within one of 23 major groups

job_title.description: Job or occupation title assigned to the funded personnel by IRIS member universities

emp_number.description: IRIS-generated unique identifier assigned to all personnel being paid by awards

fte_status.description: Designation of the status of the funded personnel (e.g., full time = 1.0, half time = .5); FTE is a university specific, not an award specific field; the value ranges between 0 and 1

object_code.description: Internal object code or other expense type category assigned to a transaction to identify payment purposes or resources

institution_id.description: IRIS-generated unique identifier assigned to each IRIS member university for de-identification purposes. Values are four or five digit numbers

fed_awd_num_std.description: Unique identifier specifying a federal award; this is the same as the unique_award_number but with the CFDA number and white spaces removed. Null if CFDA is missing or the CFDA number indicates a non-federal award, i.e., a CFDA starting with two digit numbers between 00 and 09, or 99

period_end_date.description: End of period in which a monthly expense transaction took place; each period end day is the last day of a month: e.g., 3/30/2008 or 12/31/2014

period_start_date.description: Beginning of period in which a monthly expense transaction took place; each period start day is the first day of a month: e.g., 4/1/2009 or 10/1/2015

occupational_class.description: Job classification provided by IRIS member universities

unique_award_number.description: University-generated unique identifier specifying an award and its funding source, made up of the 5-digit funding source code (e.g., CFDA number) and an award identifier. Award identifier may include the awarding agency's federal award ID (e.g., federal grant number, contract number, or loan number) or an internal award ID for non-federal awards. Values may include a space or dash in between them: e.g., 10.310 2010-12345-54321 (USDA example), 47.050 1234567 (NSF example), 93.865 2-R01-DK-012345-15-S1 (NIH example), 00.000 1234567 and 00.200 State Award 1 (Non-federal grant examples)

recipient_account_number.description: A university's internal account number to uniquely identify each project; typically an accounting code used to allocate funds received from an award

umetrics_occupational_class.description: Job classification generated by IRIS; jobs are categorized into 6 major aggregate groups (Faculty, Staff, Post Graduate Research, Graduate Student, Undergraduate, and Other). The Staff group is further classified into 6 categories (Clinical, Research, Research Facilitation, Technical Support, Instructional, Other Staff)

proportion_earnings_allocated.description: Calculated portion of earnings charged by funded personnel to the award in the specified period. This is not actual salary or dollar amounts, the value ranges between 0 and 1 depending on how much of the salary is derived from an award

team_size.description: Total number of employees paid on concurrent grants (i.e., paid this semester on grants that also fund this employee this semester)

emp_number.description: IRIS-generated unique identifier assigned to all personnel being paid by awards

fields.access_requirements: No Disclosure Agreement (NDA)
fields.description: UMETRICS consists of administrative data on member universities' research employment and expenditures. UMETRICS Award data consists of per-month transactions on member university awards, with information such as the award number, award title, campus, overhead charged, and direct expenditures. The UMETRICS Award Micro Core is a subset of this dataset, limited to the awards found in the UMETRICS Semester Core dataset. It is also limited to the years 2012-2015.
fields.dataset_citation: The underlying data can be cited as: The Institute for Research on Innovation & Science (IRIS). IRIS UMETRICS 2019 Data Release: Core Files. Ann Arbor, MI: IRIS [distributor], 2019-04-01, doi: 10.21987/2apb-6f73

fields.description: The Survey of Earned Doctorates (SED) is an annual census conducted since 1957 of all individuals receiving a research doctorate from an accredited U.S. institution in a given academic year. The SED is sponsored by the National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES) within the National Science Foundation (NSF) and by five other federal agencies: the National Institutes of Health, Department of Education, Department of Agriculture, National Endowment for the Humanities, and National Aeronautics and Space Administration. The SED collects information on the doctoral recipient's educational history, demographic characteristics, and postgraduation plans. Results are used to assess characteristics of the doctoral population and trends in doctoral education and degrees.
fields.dataset_citation: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics (NCSES), 2019, "Survey of Earned Doctorates (SED)", Applied Data Analytics Course [Distributor], 1 [Version]

fields.description: PatentsView is a patent data visualization and analysis platform intended to increase the value, utility, and transparency of US patent data. The initiative is supported by the Office of Chief Economist in the US Patent & Trademark Office (USPTO). Federal RePORTER is an initiative of STAR METRICS to create a searchable database of scientific awards from federal agencies and make this data available to the public.
